positions.subtitle: PwC
positions.description: I advise strategic and functional leaders of organizations across the Wealth Management value chain, including product & platform manufacturers and providers, as well as a myriad of service providers, including RIAs, broker-dealers, bank-based providers, and insurers.I have experience in both Management and Strategy consulting, having supported clients in the development, execution, and evaluation of organizational transformations, including:•M&A: pre-close due diligence and strategic planning, post-deal integration•Vendor selection and implementation management•Op model design and implementation•Performance improvement: cost reduction and operational assessmentsI’ve also led a variety of research-oriented initiatives, including assessing the drivers behind technology transformations in Wealth Management.
positions.title: Senior Manager
positions.description_html:
I advise strategic and functional leaders of organizations across the Wealth Management value chain, including product & platform manufacturers and providers, as well as a myriad of service providers, including RIAs, broker-dealers, bank-based providers, and insurers.

I have experience in both Management and Strategy consulting, having supported clients in the development, execution, and evaluation of organizational transformations, including:
•M&A: pre-close due diligence and strategic planning, post-deal integration
•Vendor selection and implementation management
•Op model design and implementation
•Performance improvement: cost reduction and operational assessments

I’ve also led a variety of research-oriented initiatives, including assessing the drivers behind technology transformations in Wealth Management.

experience.title: MBA Candidate
experience.description: I was proud to serve as a Johnson Leadership Fellow and Career Work Group Leader, positions in which I leveraged my prior experiences, both inside and outside of the classroom, along with extensive leadership training, to support the personal and professional development of the Johnson School's class of first-year MBA candidates. As a Johnson Admissions Group student interviewer, I also played a part in the selection of students for Johnson's future classes of MBA candidates. I was also selected by faculty to serve as a teaching assistant (TA) for several consulting-related courses.As co-president of Big Red Microenterprise (BRM), I worked closely with the Johnson School's Center for Sustainable Global Enterprise to recruit and select teams of students to act as business coaches to sustainably-focused small businesses in the Ithaca area. As vice president for business development for Big Red Consulting (BRC), I similarly engaged with community business leaders to source projects from regional and national businesses on which teams of students worked to gain real-world consulting experience.
experience.description_html:
I was proud to serve as a Johnson Leadership Fellow and Career Work Group Leader, positions in which I leveraged my prior experiences, both inside and outside of the classroom, along with extensive leadership training, to support the personal and professional development of the Johnson School's class of first-year MBA candidates. As a Johnson Admissions Group student interviewer, I also played a part in the selection of students for Johnson's future classes of MBA candidates. I was also selected by faculty to serve as a teaching assistant (TA) for several consulting-related courses.

As co-president of Big Red Microenterprise (BRM), I worked closely with the Johnson School's Center for Sustainable Global Enterprise to recruit and select teams of students to act as business coaches to sustainably-focused small businesses in the Ithaca area. As vice president for business development for Big Red Consulting (BRC), I similarly engaged with community business leaders to source projects from regional and national businesses on which teams of students worked to gain real-world consulting experience.

experience.title: Senior Associate Intern
experience.description: As a senior associate intern, I worked with clientele of various sizes to help them appropriately assess and act upon broad-based technology initiatives, while supporting client engagement work across the spectrum of development, from proposal to implementation. Leveraging my prior experience in retail and institutional client management, I assisted in the crafting of proposals, as well as the development of project plans and scopes, while meeting with and presenting to hundreds of wealth management professionals and leaders across six states.

positions.subtitle: SEI
positions.description: Working within the SEI Advisor Network’s National Accounts team, I managed strategic partnerships with independent national broker-dealers. I was responsible for the distribution of SEI’s dynamic wealth management solution to the leadership and affiliated representatives of broker-dealers, and partnered closely with key organizational personnel to ensure efficient approval and delivery of all elements of the SEI support model. Through ongoing communication, I coordinated with broker-dealers to ensure mutual attainment of business development and revenue goals.

positions.subtitle: SEI
positions.description: I partnered with a Regional Director and a Relationship Project Manager to form the internal component of a wholesaling team responsible for partnering with financial advisory firms in Northern Texas and Oklahoma. I provided case support, proposal design, practice management and client interface assistance to financial advisors seeking to grow their practice by converting and outsourcing their fee-based advisory business. Through extensive consultation and careful analysis, I put the power of SEI Investments—a leader in turnkey asset management programs—to work for advisors and their staffs. Working within the specialized framework of SEI’s Advisor Network, my external partners and I assisted in the management of assets with a market valuation of over $2.5 billion.

recommendations: Jim McGrane “Chris Beiswenger is the best consultant I have ever worked with. As IBM's engagement manger for Mead's global SAP implementation, his honesty, experience, and counsel enabled us to build a world class program that balanced internal and external resources, deliver on agressive implementation plans, and do the knowledge transfer necessary to let Mead, and subsequently MeadWestvaco, own the result to drive process improvements that yielded real value at the investment we had agreed on, on the schedule we needed. I could alwys count on Chris to tell me what I needed to know, not what I wanted to hear. His integrity is impeccable. I not only respect Chris as a professional, I have come to think of him as a close business associate and a friend.”

Mike Arcuri, PMP “Chris was one of the most dynamic leaders I have ever worked for. He had vision and drive to bring his visions to fruition. Chris is a true mentor and someone I would love to emulate.”

detailed_profile.name: Anthony Scott Greco
detailed_profile.position: Managing Director, Pharmaceutical & Life Sciences Advisory Services at PwC
detailed_profile.about: Anthony Greco is a Managing Director in PwC's Pharmaceutical & Life Sciences Advisory practice with a focus on our clients’ Government Risk and Compliance related matters. Anthony has worked with his clients to assess and design enhancements to their corporate compliance programs against the expected elements of an effective compliance program as defined by the applicable US and International laws, regulations, and industry codes. Anthony has worked with senior level executives (including c-suite) to develop multi-year compliance program strategies, including both short-term and long-terms goals and has worked closely with his clients to implement the operational enhancements to support this strategy. He has also led projects to assess pharmaceutical companies’ ability to manage a spectrum of healthcare compliance risks, providing detailed insights to the appropriate governance structure for a compliance function, policy management and training as well as risk assessment and monitoring. Anthony has prepared companies for their obligations under a Corporate Integrity Agreement, including conducting CIA Readiness assessments and mock-IRO testing. Anthony has provided support to his clients on other risk & regulatory considerations including Government Pricing, Commercial Contracting (including Gross to Net and Managed Markets), Spend and Price Transparency and Third Party Risk Management.

detailed_profile.name: Kheng Tek Chan
detailed_profile.position: Partner, PwC - Advisory Services
detailed_profile.about: Over 30 years of professional experience with PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP and its legacy Firm. Specialised in areas such as fraud/corruption investigations, corporate insolvency, debt restructuring, assets tracing/recovery, litigation support and dispute resolution assignments. Have been involved in some of Singapore’s largest corporate insolvency and restructuring engagements as well as fraud investigations of listed companies. Have also led various Foreign Corrupt Practices Act (FCPA)/Anti bribery investigations and due diligence work for US and European multinationals in the South East Asia region. A Certified Fraud Examiner (CFE), Fellow of the Institute of Singapore Chartered Accountants (ISCA) and Insolvency Practitioners Association of Singapore (IPAS) and Member of CPA Australia.

publications.title: PwC's 2016 Global Economic Crime Survey - Singapore
publications.subtitle: PwC Consulting (Singapore) Pte Ltd
publications.description: More than one fifth of companies based in Singapore experienced some form of economic crime over the past 24 months. Although companies are reporting lower incidences of fraud compared to the global average, emerging new threats require companies to adjust their line of defence. We believe this report provides valuable insights for companies to adjust the lens on economic crime and focus on making strategic preparations for future challenges and opportunities.

publications.title: PwC's 2014 Global Economic Crime Survey - Singapore
publications.subtitle: PwC Consulting (Singapore) Pte Ltd
publications.description: The Singapore edition of our 2014 Global Economic Crime survey turns the spotlight to the types of economic crime most commonly experienced in Singapore, together with the biggest perceived impact on organisations. The report also provides guidance on how companies can manage these risks. Companies that understand their risk environment well and mitigate these threats appropriately will be poised to limit thier losses to economic crime and be better positioned to respond to the ever changing global business environment we operate in.

publications.title: Wake-up call for Companies
publications.subtitle: Business Times Singapore
publications.description: The increased enforcement by regulators over bribery and corruption issues in Asia should act as a wake up call for companies in managing third party risks. The article goes into current expectations of regulators like the DOJ and what are the key features of a rigorous compliance programme when doing business or engaging with third parties.

detailed_profile.name: Vladimil R.
detailed_profile.position: Deals Senior Manager at PwC
detailed_profile.about: Vladimil Roca is a senior manager part of the PwC Deals team within the Capital Markets and Accounting Advisory Services (CMAAS) practice. As senior manager in the CMAAS practice, he helps in advising clients by providing solution oriented approaches to accounting and financial reporting challenges faced during complex transactions and events. Such transactions can include mergers & acquisitions, divestitures, initial public offerings, or services in advising clients on technical accounting matters. Vladimil is currently focused in the financial services industry (insurance, asset management, and private equity sectors), assisting companies with topics surrounding LDTI, reinsurance transactions, business combinations, consolidations, financial instruments, leases, stock based compensation, and other general topics under US GAAP, Statutory Accounting Principles, and IFRS. Experience prior to PwC advisory services consisted of providing audit services to a wide breadth of industries including financial services, construction, real estate, education, utilities, and retail.

basic_info.name: Marie
basic_info.search_snippet: Partner at PwC Advisory Services - Forensic, Disputes and Crisis Management Services · I am Partner in the Advisory Services at PwC's Montréal office.

detailed_profile.name: Marie-Chantal Dréau, CPA•IFA, MBA, CFE, CFF
detailed_profile.position: Partner at PwC Advisory Services - Forensic, Disputes and Crisis Management Services
detailed_profile.about: I am Partner in the Advisory Services at PwC’s Montréal office. I lead the Forensic & Disputes Services practice for the Québec region and lead the Crisis Management Services for PwC Canada. Known and recognized as an authority in the business community, my work consists of advising companies in preparing, responding and emerging stronger from crisis. In response times, I assist companies in the first hour, leading forensic investigations and, in the end, assist companies in asset recovery strategy, in addressing reputation risks and preventing the risk of recurrences. I have more than 25 years of experience in forensic accounting, damage quantification, audit and evaluation of business process and internal controls in the fight against fraud (anti-corruption and anti-money laundering) as well as compliance matters (AML, CFPOA). In addition to my professional experience, I give lectures, write publications and am involved in training the next generation of leaders notably at PwC and in the past at HEC Montréal and Concordia University. Keeping a balance between work, family life, personal activities and giving back to the community is very important to me. I also help women achieve their full professional potential as an active member of the ProfessionnELLES initiative at PwC’s Montréal office and on a PwC National front. This initiative’s goal is to promote the talent of our female employees. I received PWC Team Performance (2017-2018) & PwC CEO Award-Team Winner 2012, awards given to teams achieving outstanding results in client servicing & are role models for the PwC experience behaviors. I was a finalist for AFFQ’s 2013 “Étoile montante” Award, an award by the Association des Femmes en Finance du Québec (AFFQ) recognizing a member for her career development & outstanding professional qualities in the field of finance and business, and for her leadership and amazing determination. Specialties: Investigation, crisis management, dispute analysis, compliance

education.description: Activities and Societies: Women's Basketball, Sigma Beta Delta Inductee, Phi Beta Lambda PR Officer. Membership in Sigma Beta Delta is the highest national recognition a business student can receive at a college or university with a Sigma Beta Delta chapter. To be eligible for membership, a business student must rank in the top 20 percent of the junior, senior or graduate class and be invited to membership by the faculty officers. Phi Beta Lambda is an innovative business, education, and leadership organization. -Honored with Oak and Ivy - the most prestigious award at Kentucky Wesleyan College. -Served as a Student Ambassador for the Admissions Office. I conducted campus tours for prospective students as well as volunteered at special events for the college. -Women's basketball team. -PR officer for Phi Beta Lambda business association.

honors_and_awards.title: Great Midwest American All-Academic Team
honors_and_awards.description: To be named to the G-MAC Academic All-Conference Team, the student-athlete’s grade point average must be a minimum of 3.30 based on the 4.0 system, the GPA shall be cumulative for the student-athlete’s entire collegiate career and the student-athlete must have reached sophomore athletic and academic standing while completing at least one full academic year at the nominating institution.

honors_and_awards.title: 2015 -16 Who's Who Among Students in American Universities and College
honors_and_awards.description: Selected by the College's faculty and staff, as announced by KWC Vice President for Student Affairs. Students who have achieved at least a 3.0 cumulative GPA with above average participation in co-curricular activities and community service were eligible.

honors_and_awards.title: Dean's List
honors_and_awards.description: Dr. Dehn and the Kentucky Wesleyan community celebrate high achieving students each semester by awarding Dean’s List status to full-time students who achieve a 3.5 or higher GPA.

honors_and_awards.title: Ebelhar and Whitehead Junior Accounting Award
honors_and_awards.description: The Ebelhar and Whitehead Junior Accounting Award is awarded to one outstanding junior, majoring in accounting, each year at Kentucky Wesleyan College. This award is given to an individual who demonstrates an outstanding aptitude in the accounting curriculum and also exhibits a capacity to learn and grow in both academic and professional settings.

honors_and_awards.title: Oak And Ivy
honors_and_awards.description: Oak & Ivy is Kentucky Wesleyan’s highest honor. As voted on by faculty and staff, the Order of Oak and Ivy is presented annually to six students who best exhibit spiritual leadership, intellectual ability, strength of character, dedication of purpose and devotion to Christian ideals in seeking to promote the interests and welfare of Kentucky Wesleyan College.

detailed_profile.position: Manager - Advisory at PwC
detailed_profile.about: Been in to Quality Engineering Automation and Performance delivery for the past 15 years focusing mainly on functional automation of software systems. Have rich expertise in automating browser as well as desktop based applications for front end and back end validations along with services/API testing. Seasoned in managing multiple projects and teams located in different regions.Have done projects for top notch Banking, Insurance and Entertainment clients in US. Currently leading Automation and Performance testing teams. Worked on test automation tools such as Quick Test Professional 11.5 (UFT) with QC ALM integration, Selenium 2.0 using Web Driver, JAVA, Eclipse, Junit, TestNG with Maven and Jenkins CI/CD integration, C#, MS VS 2017, NANT, Test Partner, Katalon Studio, EggPlant, Cyara, Winrunner and Rational Functional Tester. Expert in creating Data, Keyword and HyBrid driven test automation frameworks from the scratch and deploying it across projects. Have very good knowledge on Performance testing of software products and worked with the performance test tool HP Load Runner, Hammer. Have expertise in end to end web services automation testing using Java Rest assured and Smart Bear's Ready API and Soap UI Version 4.5. Have performed back end validations of SQL Server and Oracle databases using 'SQL Developer Studio' and 'Oracle SQL Developer' tools and have worked on Mongo DB, Robo mongo pairs as well.

publications.title: Driving Records & Information Management Transformation: Enabling Program Adoption
publications.subtitle: PwC
publications.description: Companies are increasingly exposed to legal and regulatory risk resulting from inability to manage the staggering amount of data they generate. Now more than ever, companies must invest in consistent, understandable and defensible records management programs to structure the entire life cycle of information — from creation to destruction. The right technology is important, but “people challenges” often pose the biggest obstacles to success. Companies that anticipate and plan for these challenges are most likely to reap the benefits they seek from records management technology and process investments.

detailed_profile.about: Devon Snyder is a principal with PwC’s Advisory Services practice specializing in Business Applications. Devon spent the last 25 years helping clients solve complex business problems and achieve process improvements through the adoption of technology. A great deal of Devon’s experience comes from implementing Oracle's suite of applications. He has structured and ensured the successful delivery of over 100 implementation projects and has a relentless commitment to delivering projects on time, to scope and on budget. Since 2012, Devon focuses on helping clients adopt cloud solutions in Enterprise Resource Planning, Human Capital Management, Enterprise Performance Management and Supply Chain Management.

positions.subtitle: PwC
positions.description: Advisory: Products & Services Industries, PwC Advisory Services, People & OrganizationDrove business and talent transformations for Fortune 500 companies impacting up to 80,000 employees, $50B in revenue, and with operations around the globe. From strategy to implementation, created new processes and best practices for clients to better measure performance against set business goals. Introduced thought leadership and client solutions that reflected each client's company culture (e.g., values, communication, and processes). Achieved buy-in and trust from key stakeholders, receiving excellent feedback from client senior leadership and staff for new business processes & development approaches to improve the customer experience. With minimal supervision and staff assistance, implemented SuccessFactors Performance and Goal Management and Succession modules for 6,000 employees, including design requirements, configuration development and review, system and user acceptance testing, final design validation, data loading, go-live and cutover, and post-production support.Delivered performance management transformation to a Fortune 500 company with 30,000 employees and $17B in revenue. Revamped performance management system by creating new performance review and goal management forms in SuccessFactors in order for client to measure performance against set goals and foster quarterly meetings to provide ongoing feedback to staff and opportunities to develop throughout the year.Directed testing phases and cutover to production for module implementation, authoring 400+ test scripts for performance forms configured, crafting testing plan, and managing client throughout testing schedule. Reported less than 1% failure with functionality and client’s satisfaction led to additional projects and revenue.
positions.title: Management Consultant
positions.description_html:
Advisory: Products & Services Industries, PwC Advisory Services, People & Organization

Drove business and talent transformations for Fortune 500 companies impacting up to 80,000 employees, $50B in revenue, and with operations around the globe. From strategy to implementation, created new processes and best practices for clients to better measure performance against set business goals.

Introduced thought leadership and client solutions that reflected each client's company culture (e.g., values, communication, and processes). Achieved buy-in and trust from key stakeholders, receiving excellent feedback from client senior leadership and staff for new business processes & development approaches to improve the customer experience.

With minimal supervision and staff assistance, implemented SuccessFactors Performance and Goal Management and Succession modules for 6,000 employees, including design requirements, configuration development and review, system and user acceptance testing, final design validation, data loading, go-live and cutover, and post-production support.

Delivered performance management transformation to a Fortune 500 company with 30,000 employees and $17B in revenue. Revamped performance management system by creating new performance review and goal management forms in SuccessFactors in order for client to measure performance against set goals and foster quarterly meetings to provide ongoing feedback to staff and opportunities to develop throughout the year.

Directed testing phases and cutover to production for module implementation, authoring 400+ test scripts for performance forms configured, crafting testing plan, and managing client throughout testing schedule. Reported less than 1% failure with functionality and client’s satisfaction led to additional projects and revenue.

Served as a lead analyst, reporting directly to the Chief of the Appeals Unit, analyzing appeals, recommending adjudications on cases, and reviewing the cases of other team members for accuracy.

Researched and streamlined program implementation procedures within the Appeals Unit, contributing to a 50% reduction of the unit’s backlog, effectively rebuilding the Unit’s reputation with the Department and within powerful markets in the economy.

Performed weekly quality assurance of PERM immigration program and delivered work performance solutions that resulted in the development of improved center practices and client services to Fortune 500 employers, Congressional members, and the United States labor force.

Interpreted and utilized administrative law, federal regulations, standard operating procedures, electronic databases, and U.S. Department of Labor policies to achieve critical increase in program compliance of 75%.

Initiated continued training and regulatory guidance and supplied tools and templates to team, resulting in a demonstrated improvement in skills and performance by both federal and contract team members.

experience.title: Direct Services Coordinator
experience.description: Supervised five staff members in the execution of five government-funded public health and education programs, including establishment of policies and procedures and vendor solicitation and management.Implemented improved structure for programs provided to the County’s two million residents, resulting in greater programmatic impact, increasing participation of residents by 100%, and securing yearly funding approval by the Board of Commissioners.Designed and enacted an actionable benefits measurement framework using benchmarks and key performance indicators to measure impact of public sector programs to Fulton County’s residents.Created bid specifications for three government-funded programs opened to direct coordination by community vendors, an innovative solution allowing department staff time to focus on other significant projects; bid specifications approved by management as safeguard to maintain high level of quality and impact of programs.Managed contract compliance with vendors through benefits measurement system, providing measurable tools to track vendors’ progress, maintain vendors’ adherence to program timeline, and assess overall performance; final evaluation became critical component of future bid processes for department’s vendor selection.
experience.description_html:
Supervised five staff members in the execution of five government-funded public health and education programs, including establishment of policies and procedures and vendor solicitation and management.

Implemented improved structure for programs provided to the County’s two million residents, resulting in greater programmatic impact, increasing participation of residents by 100%, and securing yearly funding approval by the Board of Commissioners.

Designed and enacted an actionable benefits measurement framework using benchmarks and key performance indicators to measure impact of public sector programs to Fulton County’s residents.

Created bid specifications for three government-funded programs opened to direct coordination by community vendors, an innovative solution allowing department staff time to focus on other significant projects; bid specifications approved by management as safeguard to maintain high level of quality and impact of programs.

Managed contract compliance with vendors through benefits measurement system, providing measurable tools to track vendors’ progress, maintain vendors’ adherence to program timeline, and assess overall performance; final evaluation became critical component of future bid processes for department’s vendor selection.

detailed_profile.name: Lieven Adams
detailed_profile.position: External / Independent Senior Deals Advisor, excited to help you out with any deal, creating value... feeding opportunities !
detailed_profile.about: I was a Senior Deals Partner of the PwC Advisory services practice in Belgium and have been during 10 years a member of the Territory Leadership Team, as Managing Partner for Deals and Consulting. Retired from the Partnership, I am now acting as an independent Senior Deals Advisor and member of Boards and Advisory Committees. I have over 39 years of professional experience and over the last 25 years, I specialized in deal management, valuation and due diligence services. I assisted clients with domestic as well as cross-border and global transactions, ranging from mergers to acquisitions, scissions, carve-outs, disposals and restructuring. I advised clients on the full continuum of a transaction process, from strategy, over initial analysis of financial and operational performance, valuation and due diligence, through the assistance in structuring, negotiations and the determination of the final purchase price, to post-merger integration. I assisted already several local / family owned and foreign corporates, as well as local and foreign financial investors with transactions in Belgium and abroad, as well in private deals as auction processes and this within several industries. Further, I advised on public-to private and infrastructure transactions and supported local start- and scale-ups on their growth journey, including venturing advisory services to corporates.

basic_info.search_snippet: Join now to view. Websites. Global PwC Homepage: http://www.pwc.com/us/en/index.jhtml. PwC Advisory Services: http://www.pwc.com/us/en/advisory-services/index.

detailed_profile.name: Charles Jelicks
detailed_profile.position: Senior Manager Professional Services at Box
detailed_profile.about: I am currently an Implementation Consultant at Box focused on helping clients realize the true potential of Cloud Content Management. During my time as a Senior Associate at PricewaterhouseCoopers in their Advisory - Technology Consulting practice, I focused on serving clients in the Technology Media and Telecommunications industries. I built a broad base of experience in strategic program and project management and also executed product management and B2B business development projects. I graduated from The Pennsylvania State University in 2014 with a degree in Security, and Risk Analysis and a focus in Supply Chain and Information Systems. For a brief time, I worked in the Financial Services industry focused on Asset Management platform implementation. I have also worked in the public sector performing general IT support services for government organizations. I am an avid and committed lifelong learner. I have a strong commitment to honing and expanding my professional skills and network in order to increase the value I bring to any professional setting. How can I bring added value to your organization today?

positions.subtitle: PwC
positions.description: During my time as an Advisory Senior Associate at PwC, I assisted clients within the Technology Media and Telecommunications industries. I worked collaboratively with clients to help them structure, mobilize, and manage business critical initiatives, including: -Helping clients realize and extend value by designing, implementing, and executing a business to business video delivery platform feature request process. Additionally helping my clients structure large scale business development opportunities.-Working collaboratively with clients to structure and govern a 150+ person cross functional program, collaborating with change management, training, technology, and product organizations, to meet customer experience and compliance obligations.-Supervising a small team to build resource pricing modes, execute risk assessments, and deliver professional services contracts. These processes lead to decreased operational overhead and increased sales focus.
positions.title: Senior Associate
positions.description_html:

positions.subtitle: PwC
positions.description: On one engagement at a Fortune 50 company, I worked to provide large scale integration program management and technical program delivery support in anticipation of a multi-billion dollar acquisition. I worked with key stakeholders across multiple organizations to develop a detailed integration plan for end-to-end service delivery. I also oversaw the development of full cloud infrastructure integration planning. On another engagement at a Fortune 50 company in the Entertainment, Media, and Communications space, I managed key client relationships and built strong rapport with a variety of clients. I also helped drive product definition, create marketing collateral, and helped deliver a fully managed video delivery and consumption platform to B2B customers.During this time, I also managed a team of 10 Associates to ensure timely and accurate billing, invoicing, and collections for ~20 simultaneous professional services engagements.

recommendations: Shawn Horton “Charles worked with me on a very large customer project, as the implementation lead. He was absolutely essential in cultural change management with that group. He drove order from chaos, helping that customer to derive more value from their system. He lead the effort to establish formal, documented governance around data and content life cycle. Charles orchestrated involvement from other subject matter experts on his team and from product management, ensuring the customer had direct access to those involved in making changes to new products/features. He immediately established himself as a trusted adviser partner, and that customer would no doubt identify him as mission-critical to their success in that year-long endeavor. I was fortunate to work with Charles, and I would not hesitate to work with him in the future, if presented the opportunity to call him a teammate, again.”

Don Shemanski “Charles Jelicks served as a Learning Assistant for me in two separate courses at Penn State University, beginning in the Fall Semester of 2013 in my course on the Role of Information and Intelligence. I was so impressed with Charles' abilities and work ethic that I hired him again in the Spring Semester of 2014 for my course on the Legal and Regulatory Environment of privacy and Information Security. Charles excelled in both jobs. Charles Jelicks is a classic self-starter, who makes sure that he clearly understands assignments and then carries them out efficiently and in a timely manner without the need for much hands-on supervision. He possesses first-rate drafting skills. His written work was invariably well-crafted, concise and error free. I was particularly impressed with Charles' ability to synthesize and organize voluminous and complex data cogently and effectively. Charles also possessed exemplary interpersonal skills. He particularly excelled in his role as liaison to the students in my courses, a role which included managing teams and team activities and in coaching and mentoring students. Charles Jelicks was without question one of the top two Learning Assistants (out of over 60) whom I have had the honor to work with during my time at Penn State. I recommend him enthusiastically and without any reservations.”

detailed_profile.position: Chartered Accountant delivering financial and legal consulting projects.
detailed_profile.about: I am a Certified Chartered Accountant, with experience in finance and law and working towards influencing critical business decisions through producing, developing and reviewing performance measures and accounts with detailed commentary, to identify business issues and opportunities. My demonstrated success spans across various sectors where I have collaborated with teams to drive optimum efficiency and accuracy. I successfully achieve favourable business terms, measurable results and good settlements for clients within diverse sectors and at various stages of business contracts. In my current role as Director with PwC Advisory Services, Zurich, I efficiently deliver on financial and legal consulting projects and advise clients on matters of financial internal control, corporate governance, compliance and dispute resolution. Demonstrating advanced leadership, I strategically oversee and monitor finance and budgetary matters across industry and functions to achieve financial accountability and transparency. I excel at efficiently delivering solutions within multi-cultural, cross functional and ad-hoc financial and legal consulting projects. Excelling in executing all aspects of the accounting functions, along with expertise in resolving issues, ensuring adherence to contracts, internal policies and regulatory guidelines, I manage multi-jurisdictional accounting, investigative and legal projects, and develop and maintain effective partnerships with clients. I have authored numerous articles on corporate governance and financial conduct; and have been quoted in the media on bribery, corruption and intellectual property rights. I am a confident networker and negotiator with the ability to establish mutually productive working relationships.

experience.title: Director Advisory Services
experience.description: As a Director, I manage a range of operations that include multi-jurisdictional accounting, investigative and legal projects, develop and maintain effective partnerships with business customers and drive overall marketing efforts. Providing expert accounting, budget, profit-and-loss assessments and internal control reviews for clients, I successfully implement company projects, coordinate works streams, and execute mandates. I produce timely and accurate management reports including those for use in legal proceedings or for advice to solicitors or clients. I also review commercial contracts, assess risks and offer advice for optimisation. Supporting the HR function, I build and maintain an effective management team in execution of fieldwork manage and mentor junior team members.

basic_info.search_snippet: Matt Wilden is a Principal in the Cybersecurity Risk & Regulatory practice of PwC with 17 years of experience working and researching within the field of ...

detailed_profile.name: Matthew Wilden
detailed_profile.position: Partner/Principal - Cyber, Data, & Technology Risk
detailed_profile.about: Matt Wilden is a Principal in the Cybersecurity Risk & Regulatory practice of PwC with 17 years of experience working and researching within the field of information security. He has led numerous security and risk engagements across a large variety of clients within the healthcare, financial services, retail, aerospace & defense, and energy industries. Most recently Matt has been focused on supporting clients' secure cloud migrations and transformations. These efforts have included development of automating security checks within CI/CD pipelines, informing on TDDs to support secure architecture and engineering principles, deployment of Cloud Security Posture Management (CSPM) and other runtime tooling to ensure proper monitoring of the cloud platforms and container environments, building compliance programs (HITRUST, PCI, FFIEC) that take advantage of these cloud native control checks, supporting governance and risk oversight of cloud transformation activities, and upskilling the organizations' people to ensure they have the capabilities for successful operation over the long term. He also has extensive experience assisting with the development of clients’ Security Operations Centers (SOC), has overseen the maturation of multiple client's security organizations and capability models and has acted in the interim CISO role on occasion. His broader set of cyber experience includes performing digital product security assessments, threat modeling, A&Ps, breach indicator, and strategic roadmap exercises for Fortune 500 clients while regularly delivering results to the executive and board member levels. He also led, on an annual basis, a variety of security services in support of level 1 merchants’ PCI validations.

recommendations: Robert H. “I had the pleasure of working with Matt Wilden, who provided consulting services for our cybersecurity function. Matt was instrumental in developing our Cybersecurity Operations and Incident Response functions, leveraging his vast knowledge of cybersecurity to design and implement solutions tailored to our industry. His ability to bridge the gap between cybersecurity principles and industry-specific challenges ensured that our security framework was not only robust but also compliant with regulatory requirements and aligned with best practices. Matt’s deep expertise in cybersecurity governance, risk management, and compliance played a crucial role in shaping a program that met operational needs and regulatory obligations. He demonstrated an exceptional ability to interpret and apply industry standards, ensuring our solutions adhered to frameworks such as NIST, ISO 27001, and other relevant guidelines. His insights allowed us to address compliance challenges while proactively strengthening our overall security posture. Beyond his technical expertise, Matt brought a strategic mindset and a pragmatic approach to security investments. While he quickly identified additional tools and strategies that could enhance our security posture, he never pushed unnecessary solutions. Instead, he remained focused on aligning cybersecurity initiatives with our business objectives, budgetary constraints, and long-term goals. His ability to communicate complex security concepts in a way that resonated with both technical and executive stakeholders made him an invaluable asset to our team. I highly recommend Matt to any organization seeking a cybersecurity expert with a strong industry focus, deep regulatory knowledge, and a commitment to delivering practical, business-aligned security solutions. His contributions have had a lasting impact, and I would welcome the opportunity to work with him again in the future.”

PSFS designs and implements programs that transform the finance function for our clients. These full scale finance transformations optimize all elements of their finance organization.  The Capital Markets & Accounting Advisory Services| CMAAS practice advises clients on complex accounting & financial reporting matters arising from IPO's, business combinations, private placements, financing, carve-out and spin-off transactions, SEC filings and IFRS/US GAAP conversions and embedding.The Financial Due Diligence| FDD practice provides M&A advisory to some of the world's most prestigious companies thru our buy and sell-side due diligence. publications.title: Driving Records & Information Management Transformation: Enabling Program Adoption
publications.subtitle: PwC
publications.description: Companies are increasingly exposed to legal and regulatory risk resulting from inability to manage the staggering amount of data they generate. Now more than ever, companies must invest in consistent, understandable and defensible records management programs to structure the entire life cycle of information — from creation to destruction. The right technology is important, but “people challenges” often pose the biggest obstacles to success. Companies that anticipate and plan for these challenges are most likely to reap the benefits they seek from records management technology and process investments.

detailed_profile.name: Cole Krupa
detailed_profile.position: Senior Associate (Technology Consulting) at PwC
detailed_profile.about: Experience leading and developing AMI specific test case execution and development. As a member of PwC’s advisory services practice, I specialize in Grid Modernization, bringing three years of experience in RFP and requirements development, AMI deployment planning and execution, risk management, and process design for utilities. My expertise also extends to program planning, where I focus on optimizing utility operations. Currently, I am expanding my knowledge in Distributed Energy Resource Management Systems (DERMS) planning, development, and implementation. My industry experience spans energy, utilities, and alternative energy sectors, enabling me to deliver innovative solutions that drive modernization and efficiency.

basic_info.search_snippet: Experience · Director - One Africa PwC Advisory. PwC Africa Advi. Jan 2020 - Present 5 years 8 months · Associate Director PwC Advisory Services Graphic. Leader ...

detailed_profile.name: Henning Swanepoel
detailed_profile.city: City of Johannesburg, Gauteng, South Africa
detailed_profile.position: Director @ PwC Africa Advisory | Sales Strategy
detailed_profile.about: With over 13 years of experience in PwC, I am a passionate and driven leader who oversees the One Africa program for PwC Advisory from a sales, interacting and xLoS perspective. My core competencies include business and IT solutions, customer experience, digital transformation, sales excellence, and coaching. I am committed to building our sales capacity and ensuring that teams work together in achieving sales results across East, West and South Markets areas. I am motivated by PwC's mission of building trust in society and solving important problems, and I bring diverse perspectives and experiences from working in various regions and industries. In my current role as Director of One Africa PwC Advisory, I leverage our own BXT approach and the Customer Experience Team to deliver a winning formula and APW/X's that are well received by Client Relationship Partners and Priority Clients. I also partner with our Clients and Joint Business Relationship Partners in bringing a new vision to clients and helping them to imagine their future using digital growth and innovation. In addition to this role, I oversee the Local Activation Hub for Leader Sales Excellence Team within PwC Advisory, where I drive group strategy, sales excellence and coaching programs, and collaborate with regional, industry and markets drivers to increase xLoS opportunities across divisions. I have led a 5 year sales upskilling internal program within Advisory, focusing on sales methodology awareness, pursuit of opportunities, and how to win. I have also been involved in various large and complex projects, delivering business and IT solutions using Microsoft and Sage platforms. I have multiple skills, such as MMI, Microsoft CRM, and Microsoft Dynamics, that enable me to provide value to our clients and stakeholders.

experience.title: Director - One Africa PwC Advisory
experience.description: Lead the One Africa program for PwC Advisory from a sales, interacting and xLoS perspective. Working closely with the leadership in East, West and South Markets areas in building our sales capacity and ensuring that teams work together in achieving sales results. Using the Customer Experience Team and our own BXT approach has been a winning formula and APW/X's well received by Client Relationship Partners  and Priority Clients. The Digital growth in our sales approach to clients have enabled us to Partner with our Clients and Joint Business relationship Partners in bringing a new vision to clients and helping them to imagine their future.  In addition to this role I oversee the Local Activation Hub for both East & West Markets, having been part of the leadership team who set up the hugely successful LAH in the South Market. These roles has been challenging during the pandemic we find ourselves in but we have learned how to interact remotely, get the best out of teams and most importantly build trust amongst our teams and solve important problems in society. Covid has certainly taught us how to work remotely - smartly!

Working closely with the leadership in East, West and South Markets areas in building our sales capacity and ensuring that teams work together in achieving sales results. Using the Customer Experience Team and our own BXT approach has been a winning formula and APW/X's well received by Client Relationship Partners and Priority Clients. The Digital growth in our sales approach to clients have enabled us to Partner with our Clients and Joint Business relationship Partners in bringing a new vision to clients and helping them to imagine their future. In addition to this role I oversee the Local Activation Hub for both East & West Markets, having been part of the leadership team who set up the hugely successful LAH in the South Market. These roles has been challenging during the pandemic we find ourselves in but we have learned how to interact remotely, get the best out of teams and most importantly build trust amongst our teams and solve important problems in society. Covid has certainly taught us how to work remotely - smartly!

experience.title: Leader Sales Excellence Team within PwC Advisory
experience.description: Driving Group Strategy, Sales Excellence & Coaching  within the PwC Africa Advisory Division. Territories being South Africa, South Markets, East and West Africa.  This includes all sales related programs such as but not limited to - Priority Accounts, Target Accounts, Sales Performance Coaching Programs and Sales Methodology. Strategizing with Regional, Industry & Markets drivers in order to increase X-LoS opportunities across divisions. Led a 5 year Sales Upskilling internal program within Advisory focusing on Sales Methodology awareness, "Pursuit" of opportunities and How to Win. This very successful program was in conjunction with an external Sales Consultant Bruno Squara from KI Consulting and proved to unearth many 'blue diamonds" as we say in the Sales World and focused on how to close with confidence and  predictably drive sales opportunities  to successful closure, amongst many other disciplines in the sales consulting space.

experience.title: Regional Director
experience.description: New role within PwC Exordia as Regional Director overseeing growth of Exordia's services in various SA Regions & Africa.PwC’s Exordia has established itself as the leading end-to-end business and IT solutions Partner in the Microsoft and Sage arena over the last fourteen years. These solutions include ERP, CRM, SharePoint, EPM, BI and Hosting solutions. PwC's Exordia is a Gold Certified Microsoft Partner in several competencies and achieved the prestigious Microsoft Inner Circle award for five out of the last six years, placing the company amongst the top 2% of Partners worldwide.We are a proud IT services provider with a staff complement of over 200 IT professionals and support personnel. We own and operate one of the most technically advanced hosting environments in the country, located within MTN Business’ state-of-the-art data centre in Sandton, with a countrywide network providing remote access to over 3 500 client instances over 50 different client companies. Cloud offerings range from Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), to Platform as a Service (PaaS) and Software as a Service (SaaS). Today PwC’s Exordia is running 22 500+ seats of hosted services out of two data centres in Johannesburg.PwC Exordia was Microsoft South Africa's Hosting Partner of the Year in 2013 & 2014.

recommendations: Bruno Squara “I worked very closely with Henning whilst retained by PwC Consulting during the past five years on a large PwC Partner-Director Sales High Performance Coaching program. Firstly as an individual Coachee on the program and secondly in tandem to that Henning was also the PwC Director responsible for the day to day role out and running of the program in addition to his role as Sales Director and subsequently as Director responsible for the growth of the PwC Advisory business in the East and West Markets and driving the One Africa theme for PwC Advisory. He participated and sat in all my numerous coaching workshops and was exposed to my own, other international and global PwC sales success thought leadership. Critically during these workshop discussions we strongly focused on the practical application of these critical sales success factors with the PwC Sales Function and important sales pursuits. Henning has strongly benefited from his five year program participation and he now has deep sales success factor insights along with the practical understanding of how to apply them with complex, large sales pursuits. It has been a pleasure to work with Henning and can attest that he has strong Sales Leadership qualities; he is an astute planner with excellent execution, is highly disciplined and very focused on achieving and delivering high performance outcomes and results. Furthermore he is a natural leader, salesperson and a very affable individual, exuding confidence with all that he works with. Henning’s passion for sport and fitness has also stood him in good stead and in addition he is an Executive Member of the Sharks / KZNRU Rugby and has been in that role for several years. I thoroughly enjoyed coaching and working with him! ”

detailed_profile.about: Hi, my name is Kaitlynn Copinger, and I own a content writing business. I'm based in Knoxville, Tenn., but I write all over — about recycling, refugees, real estate, veterans' issues, and national parks, to name a few topics I've covered in recent years. My background is in journalism, corporate writing, and content marketing — I started my career as a journalist for the Pittsburgh Post-Gazette and have written for big organizations like PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC) and PNC Financial Services. I'm also in my volunteer era! I'm proud to run the social media accounts for the Farragut Primary School PTO as its VP of Communications, be a force for good as the Secretary for the Notre Dame Club of Knoxville / East Tennessee, and write newsletter content for the Friends of the Knox County Public Library. See my portfolio here: https://krcwritingservices.contently.com Are you looking for a writer or content creator? I'd love to help you. Please send me an email at KRCWritingServices@gmail.com or visit my website: KRCWritingServices.com Headshot: Kara Hudgens Photography Co

experience.title: Proposal Team Manager/ Senior Communications Specialist
experience.description: Within PNC’s Treasury Management group, I led multiple high-profile initiatives to enhance our internal and external messaging and content organization.As a Proposal Team manager, I established a proposal writing team, technology and process within PNC’s Treasury Management — supporting the growth of our business through compelling, client-focused messaging. As the team lead, I accomplished the following: - Guided the creation of proposal content, including cover letter and executive summary templates and standard Q&A content- Coordinated with Marketing to design a brand-standard proposal template- Implemented proposal automation technology, working with a cross-functional team at PNC and designing a training and launch plan to introduce the technology and new proposal processPrior to my promotion into this role, I served as a Senior Communications Specialist, during which time I:  - Led the development of an internal briefing book two years in a row, giving PNC’s sales officers easy-to-reference language that they could use to share compelling messages about PNC’s treasury services with clients and prospects- Spearheaded the development and launch of a new SharePoint site to organize all product content for treasury management, including designing 15 individual training sessions, quick reference guides, user guides and video training.- Wrote content for internal and external audiences
experience.description_html:
Within PNC’s Treasury Management group, I led multiple high-profile initiatives to enhance our internal and external messaging and content organization.

As a Proposal Team manager, I established a proposal writing team, technology and process within PNC’s Treasury Management — supporting the growth of our business through compelling, client-focused messaging.

As the team lead, I accomplished the following:

- Guided the creation of proposal content, including cover letter and executive summary templates and standard Q&A content
- Coordinated with Marketing to design a brand-standard proposal template
- Implemented proposal automation technology, working with a cross-functional team at PNC and designing a training and launch plan to introduce the technology and new proposal process

Prior to my promotion into this role, I served as a Senior Communications Specialist, during which time I:

- Led the development of an internal briefing book two years in a row, giving PNC’s sales officers easy-to-reference language that they could use to share compelling messages about PNC’s treasury services with clients and prospects
- Spearheaded the development and launch of a new SharePoint site to organize all product content for treasury management, including designing 15 individual training sessions, quick reference guides, user guides and video training.
- Wrote content for internal and external audiences

experience.title: Proposal Manager/Proposal Specialist
experience.description: As a member of PwC’s proposal writing team, I helped the firm win more business by creating proposal documents that were well-written, visually interesting and client-focused. Less than one year after joining PwC, I was promoted from proposal specialist to a proposal manager. In this role, I managed the work of two proposal specialists. Specializing in messaging for PwC’s Advisory Services group, I delivered strong proposals to U.S. clients while helping PwC’s proposal team expand its services to Europe and Australia.

experience.description: Manager in PwC’s Financial Services practice. Highlights of various projects:•For the PwC Talent Exchange (https://talentexchange.pwc.com/), led Agile teams working in Chicago, Bangalore, and Shanghai in designing, developing, testing, and deploying Web, iOS, and Android software suits to enable PwC engagement teams to connect with freelance contractors looking for projects.• For the financial arm of a global car manufacturer, led a program to digitize the servicing of electronic contracts.  In this role I directed the process to assess current pain points; define future needs; identify the best technical solution to go from current to future state; and advise the client on the optimal approach to implement a new digital solution, resulting in increased end-user and customer satisfaction.• For a global investment company, coordinated 18 application teams, and three technology service groups to build and deploy the infrastructure required to develop, test, and deploy to production a technology platform to provide back office services to new and existing clients.• For a Fortune 100 multinational financial services corporation, defined the scope and implemented the program management office for an initiative to streamline operations and move 700+ applications to a new infrastructure and enterprise architecture, resulting in an estimated $5MM run rate reduction per year.•  For the financial arm of a global car manufacturer, managed an engagement to define a production support organization following ITIL principles to define processes and procedures for incident, problem, change, and release management, with the goal of minimizing risks to the stability of the production environment.
experience.description_html:
Manager in PwC’s Financial Services practice. Highlights of various projects:

•For the PwC Talent Exchange (https://talentexchange.pwc.com/), led Agile teams working in Chicago, Bangalore, and Shanghai in designing, developing, testing, and deploying Web, iOS, and Android software suits to enable PwC engagement teams to connect with freelance contractors looking for projects.
• For the financial arm of a global car manufacturer, led a program to digitize the servicing of electronic contracts. In this role I directed the process to assess current pain points; define future needs; identify the best technical solution to go from current to future state; and advise the client on the optimal approach to implement a new digital solution, resulting in increased end-user and customer satisfaction.
• For a global investment company, coordinated 18 application teams, and three technology service groups to build and deploy the infrastructure required to develop, test, and deploy to production a technology platform to provide back office services to new and existing clients.
• For a Fortune 100 multinational financial services corporation, defined the scope and implemented the program management office for an initiative to streamline operations and move 700+ applications to a new infrastructure and enterprise architecture, resulting in an estimated $5MM run rate reduction per year.
• For the financial arm of a global car manufacturer, managed an engagement to define a production support organization following ITIL principles to define processes and procedures for incident, problem, change, and release management, with the goal of minimizing risks to the stability of the production environment.

experience.title: EDF Climate Corps Fellow - Energy Consultant
experience.description: The goal of my project was to reduce operational expenses related to energy consumption. I researched industry best practices, interviewed key stake holders, established an energy consumption baseline, and identified a set of possible ways to reduce energy use. I evaluated each of these options on technical and financial viability.I delivered a plan that, if implemented, would reduce energy consumption by 12% annually and have a payback close to one year on required capital investment.
experience.description_html:
The goal of my project was to reduce operational expenses related to energy consumption. I researched industry best practices, interviewed key stake holders, established an energy consumption baseline, and identified a set of possible ways to reduce energy use. I evaluated each of these options on technical and financial viability.

I delivered a plan that, if implemented, would reduce energy consumption by 12% annually and have a payback close to one year on required capital investment.

detailed_profile.name: Kar Ven Wai
detailed_profile.position: Technical Director - Investor and Lender Advisory Services
detailed_profile.about: With over nine years working in the M&A sector, I provide valuable advice to clients seeking to invest or divest global infrastructure assets. Me and my team provide commercial and technical due diligence services, as well as market outlook reviews for emerging sectors. I also have extensive experience managing a wide range stakeholders. In addition to catering to the specific needs of each individual client, I have assisted them to obtain finance by presenting business reviews to potential co-investors or financing parties, and implement post-deal advice to address business challenges faced by on-the-ground staff. My current areas of interest include the global deployment of green vehicles and reviewing the potential models which investors can adopt to optimize return on investments in electric vehicle charging or hydrogen refuelling infrastructure. In addition, I continue to enjoy working on projects involving public transportation solutions, cross-border asset portfolios, liquid bulk storage terminals and an eternally frustrating golf swing.

positions.subtitle: PwC Luxembourg
positions.description: - Provide expert advice in fund distribution for UCITS/AIFs marketing in more than 40 jurisdictions;- Act as an interface to customers and provide support and feedback on distribution issues;- Support asset managers and fund promotors to determine and launch efficient fund distribution strategies, leading to investment efficiency and economies of scale;- Resolution of distribution issues related to local investors, distribution agents and other entities supporting distribution;- Monitoring ongoing regulatory reporting, deadlines, publication and tax reporting obligations;- Compliance review of fund’ publications;- Compliance of fund marketing materials (website, factsheets, roadshow materials);- Initial and on-going due diligence of local distributors;- Management of multiple teams and various projects;- Cooperation with international clients, global network, wealth management experts and third parties entities;- Participation in various market research and evaluation studies for customers to determine the desired cross-border sales strategy;- Development of new services offering.
positions.title: Senior Manager Advisory Services - Global Fund Distribution
positions.description_html:
- Provide expert advice in fund distribution for UCITS/AIFs marketing in more than 40 jurisdictions;
- Act as an interface to customers and provide support and feedback on distribution issues;
- Support asset managers and fund promotors to determine and launch efficient fund distribution strategies, leading to investment efficiency and economies of scale;
- Resolution of distribution issues related to local investors, distribution agents and other entities supporting distribution;
- Monitoring ongoing regulatory reporting, deadlines, publication and tax reporting obligations;
- Compliance review of fund’ publications;
- Compliance of fund marketing materials (website, factsheets, roadshow materials);
- Initial and on-going due diligence of local distributors;
- Management of multiple teams and various projects;
- Cooperation with international clients, global network, wealth management experts and third parties entities;
- Participation in various market research and evaluation studies for customers to determine the desired cross-border sales strategy;
- Development of new services offering.

experience.title: Consultant

experience.title: Management Consultant
experience.description: Manager in PwC’s Financial Services practice. Highlights of various projects:•For the PwC Talent Exchange (https://talentexchange.pwc.com/), led Agile teams working in Chicago, Bangalore, and Shanghai in designing, developing, testing, and deploying Web, iOS, and Android software suits to enable PwC engagement teams to connect with freelance contractors looking for projects.• For the financial arm of a global car manufacturer, led a program to digitize the servicing of electronic contracts.  In this role I directed the process to assess current pain points; define future needs; identify the best technical solution to go from current to future state; and advise the client on the optimal approach to implement a new digital solution, resulting in increased end-user and customer satisfaction.• For a global investment company, coordinated 18 application teams, and three technology service groups to build and deploy the infrastructure required to develop, test, and deploy to production a technology platform to provide back office services to new and existing clients.• For a Fortune 100 multinational financial services corporation, defined the scope and implemented the program management office for an initiative to streamline operations and move 700+ applications to a new infrastructure and enterprise architecture, resulting in an estimated $5MM run rate reduction per year.•  For the financial arm of a global car manufacturer, managed an engagement to define a production support organization following ITIL principles to define processes and procedures for incident, problem, change, and release management, with the goal of minimizing risks to the stability of the production environment.
experience.description_html:
Manager in PwC’s Financial Services practice. Highlights of various projects:

•For the PwC Talent Exchange (https://talentexchange.pwc.com/), led Agile teams working in Chicago, Bangalore, and Shanghai in designing, developing, testing, and deploying Web, iOS, and Android software suits to enable PwC engagement teams to connect with freelance contractors looking for projects.
• For the financial arm of a global car manufacturer, led a program to digitize the servicing of electronic contracts. In this role I directed the process to assess current pain points; define future needs; identify the best technical solution to go from current to future state; and advise the client on the optimal approach to implement a new digital solution, resulting in increased end-user and customer satisfaction.
• For a global investment company, coordinated 18 application teams, and three technology service groups to build and deploy the infrastructure required to develop, test, and deploy to production a technology platform to provide back office services to new and existing clients.
• For a Fortune 100 multinational financial services corporation, defined the scope and implemented the program management office for an initiative to streamline operations and move 700+ applications to a new infrastructure and enterprise architecture, resulting in an estimated $5MM run rate reduction per year.
• For the financial arm of a global car manufacturer, managed an engagement to define a production support organization following ITIL principles to define processes and procedures for incident, problem, change, and release management, with the goal of minimizing risks to the stability of the production environment.

experience.title: EDF Climate Corps Fellow - Energy Consultant
experience.description: The goal of my project was to reduce operational expenses related to energy consumption. I researched industry best practices, interviewed key stake holders, established an energy consumption baseline, and identified a set of possible ways to reduce energy use. I evaluated each of these options on technical and financial viability.I delivered a plan that, if implemented, would reduce energy consumption by 12% annually and have a payback close to one year on required capital investment.
experience.description_html:
The goal of my project was to reduce operational expenses related to energy consumption. I researched industry best practices, interviewed key stake holders, established an energy consumption baseline, and identified a set of possible ways to reduce energy use. I evaluated each of these options on technical and financial viability.

I delivered a plan that, if implemented, would reduce energy consumption by 12% annually and have a payback close to one year on required capital investment.

experience.title: Product Manager Intern
experience.description: I coordinated the development of a sales tracking application that automated global sales reporting. The end product cut time to access global sales metrics facilitating improving product managers’ responsiveness.

Pablo is a high-integrity and capable leader who easily bridges the gap between business, technology, and different cultures to deliver solid analyses and recommendations.”

detailed_profile.name: Kar Ven Wai
detailed_profile.position: Technical Director - Investor and Lender Advisory Services
detailed_profile.about: With over nine years working in the M&A sector, I provide valuable advice to clients seeking to invest or divest global infrastructure assets. Me and my team provide commercial and technical due diligence services, as well as market outlook reviews for emerging sectors. I also have extensive experience managing a wide range stakeholders. In addition to catering to the specific needs of each individual client, I have assisted them to obtain finance by presenting business reviews to potential co-investors or financing parties, and implement post-deal advice to address business challenges faced by on-the-ground staff. My current areas of interest include the global deployment of green vehicles and reviewing the potential models which investors can adopt to optimize return on investments in electric vehicle charging or hydrogen refuelling infrastructure. In addition, I continue to enjoy working on projects involving public transportation solutions, cross-border asset portfolios, liquid bulk storage terminals and an eternally frustrating golf swing.

detailed_profile.name: Kevin Maraj
detailed_profile.position: Director at PwC
detailed_profile.about: Currently a Director in PwC Advisory Services Group and employed with PwC since 2005. Fellow of the Association of Chartered Certified Accountants and member of ICATT. Holder of an MBA, LLB and LPC and the CIA and CISA designations. Responsible for a suite of Advisory engagements including due diligence (financial, reputation and tax), financial modelling, valuation, receiverships, liquidations, forensics, corporate finance and debt/ balance sheet and operational restructuring reviews amongst others - finance function effectiveness reviews, finance policy consulting projects etc. Prior to joining Advisory, gained over 5 years experience in PwC's Risk and Control Services practice performing risk assessments, internal audit assurance and consulting reviews, IT audit reviews and regulatory compliance reviews.

basic_info.search_snippet: ... PwC advisory services, where she played a key role in finance and accounting, transactions (financial due diligence), business recovery and forensic audits ...

detailed_profile.name: Hilda Mahama, CPA
detailed_profile.position: Aviation and Aerospace- FCCA (UK), MBA
detailed_profile.about: Hilda Mahama is a chartered accountant by profession and an organizational leadership graduate from Harvard Business School Online. She is currently advising Bombardier, a global aviation leader, on the rapid evolution of IFRS, the company's accounting policies and financial reporting as well as IFRS Sustainability Disclosure Standards -IFRS S1 and S2, ESG reporting- financial areas reviews. Previously, she was an experienced manager at PwC Canada and an audit lead at Schwartz Levitsky Feldman, Canada - HLB International. She has over 10 years of work experience providing assurance, tax and advisory services to clients in various industries: publicly listed companies (using PCAOB, IFRS), private sector companies (including insurance companies, investment companies, manufacturing companies, aircraft parts companies, retail companies,...) using Canadian ASPE, US GAAP, IFRS and ASNPO. She has experience in non-typical engagements such as prospectuses, MD&A circle ups, non-assurance works with International development organizations such as UNDP, ADB, EU, USAID, World Bank, DfID, KfW and UN agencies among others.Prior to moving into assurance, she was a financial analyst with PwC advisory services, where she played a key role in finance and accounting, transactions (financial due diligence), business recovery and forensic audits. She has work and other experience in Canada, several countries in Africa, France, several states in the USA, UK, Germany, Belgium, Amsterdam, Italy, etc. Areas of experience  Audit and assurances services  Experience in the audit of projects funded by the Worldbank , EU, United States Government, UN Agencies, UNDP and other International Donor Organizations. Audits of financial statements in accordance with IPSAS.  Environmental, social and Governance (ESG), IFRS Sustainability Disclosure Standards -IFRS S1 and S2, Sustainable finance.  System audits, SEC regulations, SOX controls and Institutional assessments in Financial Management Systems  Assurance services to government ministries  Expenditure verification  Investigative review  Independent Business Review  Vendor Assistance Review including working capital analysis  Fraud Risk Assessment  Business Process Reengineering  Improving the efficiency of spending  Investigations into plastic inventory records  Financial Modelling  Wide experience in advisory services such as pre disbursement assessments, review and improvement of internal controls  Translations of reports from English to French language and vice versa

detailed_profile.name: Tamara Moravia-Israel
detailed_profile.position: International Tax and Global Tax Controversy at PwC
detailed_profile.about: Tamara Moravia-Israel is an International Tax Partner for PricewaterhouseCoopers. Tamara is active in the areas of tax controversy/representation of clients before the IRS, international restructuring, global information reporting, and transfer pricing. Prior to 2006, Tamara was Senior Counsel for the IRS, Office of Chief Counsel for eight years. Tamara was Industry Counsel for Shipping and Marine, Air Transport, and International Penalties. Tamara graduated from Nova Southeastern University with a J.D. and from the University of Miami with a L.LM. in Taxation, specializing in International Tax. Tamara speaks five languages including English, Spanish, Portuguese, French, and Hebrew; additionally, she is conversational in Arabic.

detailed_profile.name: Brian Snarzyk
detailed_profile.city: Ladys Island, South Carolina, United States
detailed_profile.position: Retired Principal at PricewaterhouseCoopers
detailed_profile.about: Brian Snarzyk is a retired Principal at PwC, where he was responsible for building and scaling operational innovations across the firm. He focused on complex, high-stakes initiatives with transformative business impact. During his career he: · Led the global, cross-functional team that built and launched PwC's Talent Exchange, an industry-first professional services marketplace that connects top independent talent with PwC project work. In the growing freelance economy, the Talent Exchange equips PwC to stay ahead of a transforming workforce by finding, connecting with and working alongside the market’s best freelance talent to deliver high-quality client outcomes. · Orchestrated the creation and roll out of PwC’s Leadership Development Experience (LDE), a progressive talent approach geared to help PwC build leaders at all levels. LDE puts live information and actions at the fingertips of PwC’s people, leaders and human capital professionals. They can now perform talent-related actions in less time while accessing live data, analytics and learning needed to accelerate their growth. · Drove the US and UK launch of PwC’s new CRM system, overseeing all business and system readiness, platform stability, vendor relations, training/comms and cut-over planning. Brian’s team planned and launched the system and then rapidly built and deployed enhanced business functionality ahead of schedule, with zero defects, and under budget. Earlier in his career at PwC, Brian served as the US Advisory Leader of Global Delivery and Managed Services where he worked to advance PwC’s global delivery solutions across PwC’s global network. Prior to joining PwC, Brian was an Executive VP at BearingPoint and a Principal at KPMG. At these firms he focused on leading the deployment of global solutions and business-critical IT projects. Before that, he was a Captain in the US Army where he managed battlefield IT systems.
